23FEB06-d-02-23-06-LCR.Narrative: ON FEBRUARY  23, 2006 AT APPROXIMATELY 1:15 PM I WAS WORKING  AS THE UTILITY-MAN ON A SOUTHBOUND FREIGHT TRAIN FROM LAKEVIEW, OREGON TO ALTURAS, CALIFORNIA.  THE TRAIN WAS OPERATED BY THE LAKE COUNTYRAILROAD (LCR) AND I WAS AN EMPLOYEE OF THAT CARRIER. IT WAS A COOL WINTER DAY AND SUN WAS SHINING.WE HAD 10 CARS IN THE TRAIN ; (7) COVERED HOPPERS FILLED PERLITE AMD (3) CENTER BEAMS HAULING LUMBER.  WE HAD TRAVELED 44 MILES FROM INITIAL TERMINAL.  WE HAD BEEN ON DUTY 6 HRS AND  30 MINS. I WAS CHECKING THE STATUS OF THE TRAIN FROM THE CONDUCTOR'S STATION WHILE THE TRAIN WAS NEGOTIATING A LEFTHAND CURVE.  I SAW THE REAR OF THE FIRST CAR (HEAD END) OR THE FRONT OF THE SECOND CAR DERAIL AND START TRACKING ON THE TIES.  I INFORMED THE ENGINEER THAT THE TRAIN WAS  ON THE GROUND.  HE MOVED THEAIR CONTROLS AND REPEATED THAT WE WEE ON THE GROUND.  ENGINEER ACKNOWLEDGED ME AND STATED HE WAS GETTING THE TRAIN STOPPED.  I'M NOT SURE OF THE TRAIN SPEED BECAUSE A SPEEDOMETE WAS NOT VISIBLE TO ME.WE WERE MOVING PRETTY SLOW. AFTER THE TRAIN STOPPED WE CHECKED THE SITUATION AND FOUND (5) FIVE  CARS DERAILED.  WE WERE UNABLE TO CONTACT ANYONE DUE TO THE RADIO WAVES IN THE CANYON.  WE PULLLED THE LOCOMOTIVES AWAY FROM THE CARS AND PULLED FARTHER SOUTH UNTIL WE HAD GOOD CELL PHONE INDICATORS  AT THAT TIME LCR SUPERINTENDENT WAS PASSING THE SITE AND CALLED US TO SEE WHAT HAD HAPPEN.  WE MET BACK AT THE SCENE AND GATES INSTRUCTED US TO PULL THE LOCOMOTIVE DOWN TO A CLEARING AND SECURE IT.

405134-d-02-17-06-IC.Narrative: WHILE PERFORMING NORMAL SWITCHING DUTIES, JOB R98271 WAS SWITCHING ON THE NORTH END OF GEISMAR YARDIN HEAVY FOG.  WHEN THEY KICKED CAR GATX 32100 INTO #8 TRACK AND IT DID NOT CLEAR THE NORTH SWITCHING LEAD.  THEY THEN KICKED GATX 89109 AND GATX 96165 TO #10 TRACK, NOT REALIZING THAT GATX 32100 ON TRACK #8 WAS OUT TO FOUL.  GATX 32100 SIDESWIPED GATX 89109 AND GATX 96165 AS THEY ROLLED PAST.  ALLCARS INVOLVED WERE LOADED HAZARDOUS CARS AND THERE WAS NO SPILL OR LEAK OF PRODUCT.  THE CONDUCTOR AND BRAKEMAN WERE TESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  THE CAR DID NOT DERAIL AND THERE WAS NO TRACK DAMAGE.

195180-d-02-05-06-SOO.Accident Cause: Highway user cited for violation of highway-rail grade crossing traffic laws
195180-d-02-05-06-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 152-04 WAS PROCEEDING EAST (COMPASS NORTHEAST) ON THE NS DETROIT DISTRICT, HUNTINGTON SUB. THROUGH THE TOWN OF ADRIAN, MI. CREW HAD PROCEEDED OVER THE CROSSING AT MP D61.5 (CARLETON RD) BY ABOUT15 CAR LENGTHS AND 2 LOCOMOTIVES WHEN A 1996 CHEVY ASTRO VAN; LIC. # YST419 MI (TRAVELING WEST) STRUCK THE SIDE OF THE 16TH CAR (TTAX 75899 SPINE CAR). THE WEST TRUCK ON THE A END (R-4 WHEEL) WAS KNOCKED OFF THE RAIL AT CARLETON RD (POD). THE CAR CONTINUED ON THE GROUND FOR APPROXIMATELY 1500 FT. WHERE IT TRIED TO RERAIL ITSELF ON A FROG BETWEEN #1 & #2 TRACK. THE TRAIN THEN LOST AIR, WENT INTO EMERGENCY AND STOPPED ABOUT 600 FT PAST THE CONTROL POINT @ STAN. CONDUCTOR ON TRAIN 152-04 MADE EMERGENCY CALL VIA THE RADIO, THEN PROCEEDED TO WALK HIS TRAIN. WHEN HE GOT TO THE 16TH CAR HE NOTICED THE WEST TRUCK ON THE GROUND, AND THAT THE REST OF THE TRAIN WAS NOT THERE. HE WALKED AROUND THE CURVE AND SAW CARS IN THE FIELD ON BOTH SIDES OF THE TRACK.  THE ENGINEER ESTIMATED THE SPEED OF THE TRAIN WHEN HE LOST HIS AIR AT 32 MPH. 8 CARS DERAILED; TTAX 75899; CP 506310 ( HAZARDOUS ) NOT LEAKING;CP 521040; TTAX 76163; CP 522813; TTRX 370108; CP 313847; CP 522270. HULCHER AND THE NS ES DEPARTMENT WERE AT THE SCENE. NS ESTIMATED TRACK & SIGNAL REPAIR COSTS $30,000.00.  LOCOMOTIVE DOWNLOAD INDICATES TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY AT 9:05 EST.

195477-d-02-26-06-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Highway user deliberately disregarded crossing warning devices
195477-d-02-26-06-SOO.Accident Cause: Highway user deliberately disregarded crossing warning devices
195477-d-02-26-06-SOO.Narrative: AMTRAK #7 TRAVELING AT 79 MPH STRUCK VEHICLE AT COUNTY HIGHWAY F - IXONIA, WI. ENGINEER OBSERVED CARATTEMPTING TO DRIVE AROUND THE LOWERED GATES & PLACED TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY BEFORE IMPACT, STOPPINGIN 2200' FROM INITIAL POINT OF BRAKE APPLICATION. A WITNESS AT THE SCENE STATED THE GATES WERE IN THE LOWERED POSITION, THE LIGHTS & BELLS OF THE CROSSING WERE WORKING & THAT THE LOCOMOTIVE'S HEADLIGHTS WERE ON BRIGHT. FROM THE WITNESS' STATEMENT IT APPEARS THE AUTO INVOLVED IN THE INCIDENT WAS TRAVELING NORTH & HAVING DRIVEN AROUND THE LOWERED GATE WAS STRUCK ON THE PASSENGER SIDE BY THE LOCOMOTIVE. AUTO WAS SHEARED IN TWO BY THE IMPACT, THE REAR PORTION OF THE VEHICLE REMAINED ON THE FRONT OFTHE LOCOMOTIVE WHILE THE FRONT PORTION WAS THROWN ABOUT 30 FEET INTO AN ADJACENT RAILROAD FENCE GATE. DRIVER WAS EJECTED AND SUSTAINED FATAL INJURY. THE CROSSING WARNING DEVICE ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE CROSSING WAS STRUCK BY THE FRONT HALF OF THE VEHICLE AND WAS SHEARED OFF IT'S FOUNDATION.  AMTRAKADVISES APPROXIMATELY $500 EQUIPMENT REPAIRS TO LEAD LOCOMOTIVE.
